metadata.description: Example of Palaver-style consensus building - validates before advancing

messages.content: I'm so frustrated with my sister. She never listens to me and always thinks she's right.
I hear that you're feeling frustrated. It sounds like there's been a pattern where you feel unheard in conversations with your sister. Is that right?
Yes, exactly. Every time I try to share my opinion, she interrupts or dismisses it.

So when you share your opinion, you experience being interrupted or dismissed. That would be frustrating for anyone. Before we go further - is there a specific recent situation where this happened that's on your mind?
Last week we were planning our mom's birthday party and she just took over everything without asking what I thought.

Thank you for sharing that. So during the planning for your mom's birthday, you felt your sister took over without seeking your input. It sounds like you wanted to be part of the decision-making. I'm curious - in an ideal situation, what would that collaboration have looked like for you?
I just wanted her to ask me what I thought before deciding things. Maybe split the responsibilities.

That sounds very reasonable - wanting to be asked, wanting shared responsibility. Those are fair expectations between siblings planning something together. Have you been able to express this to her directly?
